abstract.t: This document defines the HTTP Cookie and Set-Cookie headers. These headers can be used by HTTP servers to store state (called cookies) at HTTP user agents, letting the servers maintain a stateful session over the mostly stateless HTTP protocol. Although cookies have many historical infelicities that degrade their security and privacy, the Cookie and Set-Cookie headers are widely used on the Internet.Editorial Note (To be removed by RFC Editor) If you have suggestions for improving this document, please send email to http-state@ietf.org.
